extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Tina on 3/23/2015.

    • Method Detail

      • getAnt

        public Ant getAnt(Position pos)
           throws AntNotFoundException
        Get an Ant object from the list of Ants stored in the given colony.
        Parameters:
        pos - The cell position of the ant to be found
        Returns:
        The Ant at indicated position
        Throws:
        AntNotFoundException

      • getAnt

        public Ant getAnt(int id)
           throws AntNotFoundException
        Get an Ant object from the list of Ants stored in the given colony.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the ant to be found
        Returns:
        The Ant object with given id
        Throws:
        AntNotFoundException

      • getNumberOfAnts

        public int getNumberOfAnts()
        Get the number of ants currently alive belonging to the colony
        Returns:
        Number of ants still alive

      • isAntAlive

        public boolean isAntAlive(int id)
        When given an ant id, will return true if specified ant is alive
        Parameters:
        id - ant id to check whether alive
        Returns:
        true if ant alive, false otherwise

      • getFoodInColony

        public int getFoodInColony()
        Get the total amount of food held by the colony. This does not include food held by individual ants belonging to the colony.
        Returns:
        Amount of food in colony

      • incrementFood

        public void incrementFood()
        Increments the total amount of food belonging to the colony by 1. Invoked when an ant returns to the colony with food as it can only carry one particle at a time

      • setBrain

        public void setBrain(Brain brain)
        Load the colony with the given brain. This controls the behaviour of every ant in the colony. The brain is fundamental to the operation of the colony and this method must be invoked before the game begins
        Parameters:
        brain -

      • getBrain

        public Brain getBrain()
        Returns the brain which has been loaded into the colony
        Returns:
        the colony brain

      • getColonyColour

        public Colour getColonyColour()
        Returns the colony colour, allowing differentiation between the two competing teams
        Returns:
        RED or BLACK

      • setColonyColour

        public void setColonyColour(Colour colour)
        This method set the colony colour
        Parameters:
        colour -

      • remove

        public void remove(int id)
            throws AntNotFoundException
        Removes ant belonging to this objects colony by removing it from the list of ants. When an ant is killed it turns into 3 particles of food. This method is invoked from the killEnemyAnt method in an Ant object
        Parameters:
        id - position of the ant to be killed
        Throws:
        AntNotFoundException

      • addAnt

        public void addAnt(Ant ant)
        This method add an Ant into the ant list
        Parameters:
        ant, - that will be added into the list

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This method resets all the states of an Ant
